item.title: The Authenticity, Choice, and Technology Lab
item.description:
The Authenticity, Choice, and Technology Lab The ACT Lab is actively seeking research assistants
The ACT (Authenticity, Choice, and Technology) Lab is looking for research assistants (for credit or unpaid) to work with Sheena Iyengar of the Columbia Business School over the semester and beyond. Sheena works in social psychology and specializes in subjects such as innovation, authenticity, and how choice influences decisions and perceptions.

item.title: The Couples Lab
item.description: The Couples Lab The Couples Lab is not actively seeking research assistants In the Columbia Couples Lab we study dyadic processes (i.e. interactions between two individuals), particularly in health-relevant contexts. Our primary lines of research include how people co-experience stress, how people support each other through adversity, and how people cope with stress (e.g., do they co-ruminate?). We aim to understand how social relationships influence people’s functioning, especially during times of stress, as well as how the relationship itself functions during these adverse experiences.

item.title: The Higgins Lab
item.description: The Higgins Lab The Higgins Lab is not actively seeking research assistants In the Higgins Lab, we study the motivational underpinnings of perceptions, judgments, decisions, and behaviors in a wide range of contexts. Ongoing projects in our lab explore how different fundamental motives influence how people relate to each other, navigate their social worlds, and pursue their goals. We embrace a motivated cognition framework in pursuing both basic and applied research questions
